Description: Pottery vase made of Nile silt clay, with round body, short neck and everted roll rim, coated with a thick red slip and burnished.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 19; pl. xxxii. 81b Like Polished red ware P81b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Probably from Mahasna grave H110, but not marked on body.
